sample_poem.title: Le Laüstic
sample_poem.french:
Le rossignol chante la nuit
Quand tout le monde dort,
Il dit son amour sans bruit
Dans l'ombre de la mort.
sample_poem.english:
The nightingale sings at night
When everyone sleeps,
He tells his love without sound
In the shadow of death.
sample_poem.pronunciation:
luh roh-see-nyol shahnt lah nwee
kahn too luh mohnd dor,
eel dee sohn ah-moor sahn bwee
dahn lohn-bruh duh lah mor

sample_poem.title: Extrait de Lancelot
sample_poem.french:
L'amour est une fleur délicate
Qui fleurit dans le cœur,
Mais peut se faner si l'on tarde
À la protéger de la peur.
sample_poem.english:
Love is a delicate flower
That blooms in the heart,
But can wither if one delays
To protect it from fear.
sample_poem.pronunciation:
lah-moor ay oon fluhr day-lee-kaht
kee fluh-ree dahn luh kuhr,
may puh suh fah-nay see lohn tard
ah lah proh-tay-zhay duh lah puhr

sample_poem.title: Mignonne, allons voir si la rose
sample_poem.french:
Mignonne, allons voir si la rose
Qui ce matin avait déclose
Sa robe de pourpre au soleil,
A point perdu cette vesprée
Les plis de sa robe pourprée,
Et son teint au vôtre pareil.
sample_poem.english:
Sweetheart, let's go see if the rose
That this morning had unfolded
Her purple dress in the sun,
Has lost this evening
The folds of her purple dress,
And her complexion like yours.
sample_poem.pronunciation:
mee-nyohn, ah-lohn vwar see lah rohz
kee suh mah-tan ah-vay day-klohz
sah rohb duh poor-pruh oh soh-lay,
ah pwan pair-doo set-uh vay-spray
lay plee duh sah rohb poor-pray,
ay sohn tan oh vo-truh pah-ray

sample_poem.title: Heureux qui, comme Ulysse
sample_poem.french:
Heureux qui, comme Ulysse, a fait un beau voyage,
Ou comme celui-là qui conquit la toison,
Et puis est retourné, plein d'usage et raison,
Vivre entre ses parents le reste de son âge !
sample_poem.english:
Happy he who, like Ulysses, has made a beautiful journey,
Or like that one who conquered the fleece,
And then returned, full of experience and reason,
To live among his parents the rest of his age!
sample_poem.pronunciation:
uh-ruh kee, kohm oo-lees, ah fay uhn boh vah-yahzh,
oo kohm suh-lwee-lah kee kohn-kee lah twah-zohn,
ay pwee ay ruh-toor-nay, plan doo-zahzh ay ray-zohn,
vee-vruh ahn-truh say pah-rahn luh ress-tuh duh sohn ahzh

sample_poem.title: Le Corbeau et le Renard
sample_poem.french:
Maître Corbeau, sur un arbre perché,
Tenait en son bec un fromage.
Maître Renard, par l'odeur alléché,
Lui tint à peu près ce langage :
sample_poem.english:
Master Crow, perched on a tree,
Held in his beak a cheese.
Master Fox, attracted by the smell,
Spoke to him in this way:
sample_poem.pronunciation:
may-truh kor-boh, soor uhn ar-bruh pair-shay,
tuh-nay ahn sohn bek uhn froh-mahzh.
may-truh ruh-nar, par loh-duhr ah-lay-shay,
lwee tan ah puh pray suh lah-gahzh

sample_poem.title: Demain, dès l'aube
sample_poem.french:
Demain, dès l'aube, à l'heure où blanchit la campagne,
Je partirai. Vois-tu, je sais que tu m'attends.
J'irai par la forêt, j'irai par la montagne.
Je ne puis demeurer loin de toi plus longtemps.
sample_poem.english:
Tomorrow, at dawn, at the hour when the countryside whitens,
I will leave. You see, I know that you are waiting for me.
I will go through the forest, I will go through the mountain.
I cannot stay far from you any longer.
sample_poem.pronunciation:
duh-man, day lohb, ah luhr oo blahn-shee lah kahn-pah-nyuh,
zhuh par-tee-ray. vwah too, zhuh say kuh too mah-tahn.
zhuh-ree-ay par lah foh-ray, zhuh-ree-ay par lah mohn-tah-nyuh.
zhuh nuh pwee duh-muh-ray lwan duh twah ploo lohn-tahn

sample_poem.title: Le Lac
sample_poem.french:
Ainsi, toujours poussés vers de nouveaux rivages,
Dans la nuit éternelle emportés sans retour,
Ne pourrons-nous jamais sur l'océan des âges
Jeter l'ancre un seul jour ?
sample_poem.english:
Thus, always pushed towards new shores,
In eternal night carried away without return,
Will we never be able on the ocean of ages
To cast anchor for a single day?
sample_poem.pronunciation:
an-see, too-zhoor poo-say vair duh noo-voh ree-vahzh,
dahn lah nwee ay-tair-nel ahn-por-tay sahn too-roor,
nuh poo-rohn-noo zhah-may soor loh-say-ahn day zahzh
zhuh-tay lahn-kruh uhn suhl zhoor

sample_poem.title: L'Albatros
sample_poem.french:
Souvent, pour s'amuser, les hommes d'équipage
Prennent des albatros, vastes oiseaux des mers,
Qui suivent, indolents compagnons de voyage,
Le navire glissant sur les gouffres amers.
sample_poem.english:
Often, to amuse themselves, the crewmen
Take albatrosses, vast seabirds,
Who follow, indolent traveling companions,
The ship gliding over bitter abysses.
sample_poem.pronunciation:
soo-vahn, poor sah-moo-zay, lay zohm day-kee-pahzh
pren duh zal-bah-tros, vahst wah-zoh day mair,
kee swee-vahn, an-doh-lahn kohn-pah-nyohn duh vah-yahzh,
luh nah-veer glee-sahn soor lay goof-ruh zah-mair

sample_poem.title: Chanson d'automne
sample_poem.french:
Les sanglots longs
Des violons
De l'automne
Blessent mon cœur
D'une langueur
Monotone.
sample_poem.english:
The long sobs
Of the violins
Of autumn
Wound my heart
With a languor
Monotonous.
sample_poem.pronunciation:
lay sahn-gloh lohn
day vee-oh-lohn
duh loh-tohn
blay-sahn mohn kuhr
doon lahng-guhr
moh-noh-tohn

novels.title: Candide

novels.summary: Satirical work questioning optimism and exploring human nature

novels.title: Les Misérables

novels.summary: Epic tale of redemption, justice, and social inequality in 19th century France

novels.title: Madame Bovary
novels.author: Gustave Flaubert
novels.summary: Story of a provincial woman's romantic illusions and tragic downfall

novels.title: À la recherche du temps perdu
novels.author: Marcel Proust
novels.summary: Seven-volume exploration of memory, time, and consciousness

novels.title: L'Étranger
novels.author: Albert Camus
novels.summary: Story of an indifferent man who commits murder and faces the absurdity of existence

plays.title: Le Cid
plays.author: Pierre Corneille
plays.summary: Tragic conflict between love and honor in medieval Spain

famous_quote.french: À vaincre sans péril, on triomphe sans gloire.
famous_quote.english: To conquer without peril is to triumph without glory.
famous_quote.pronunciation: ah van-kruh sahn pay-reel, ohn tree-ohnf sahn glwar

plays.title: Phèdre
plays.author: Jean Racine
plays.summary: Tragic story of forbidden love and divine punishment

famous_quote.french: C'est Vénus tout entière à sa proie attachée.
famous_quote.english: It's Venus entirely attached to her prey.
famous_quote.pronunciation: say vay-noos too tahn-tyair ah sah prwah ah-tah-shay

plays.title: Le Mariage de Figaro
plays.author: Pierre-Augustin Caron de Beaumarchais
plays.summary: Satirical comedy about social classes and marriage

famous_quote.french: Sans la liberté de blâmer, il n'est point d'éloge flatteur.
famous_quote.english: Without the freedom to criticize, there is no flattering praise.
famous_quote.pronunciation: sahn lah lee-bair-tay duh blah-may, eel nay pwan day-lohzh flah-tuhr
